item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, January 22, 2025 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Ross Ulbricht granted a full pardon (726 points | 784 comments)
2. Stargate Project: SoftBank, OpenAI, Oracle, MGX to build data centers (555 points | 595 comments)
3. Moving on from React, a year later (119 points | 58 comments)
4. 0-click deanonymization attack targeting Signal, Discord, other platforms (1124 points | 365 comments)
5. Infinigen (50 points | 5 comments)
6. Hunyuan3D 2.0 – High-Resolution 3D Assets Generation (162 points | 68 comments)
7. Isolating complexity is the essence of successful abstractions (59 points | 8 comments)
8. Tensor Product Attention Is All You Need (30 points | 24 comments)
9. Ask HN: How are you preparing for PEPPOL? (15 points | 11 comments)
10. Invisible Electrostatic Wall at 3M plant (1996) (314 points | 159 comments)
11. What are these bumps on the top of a pull-tab can? (111 points | 7 comments)
12. Why is zero plural? (2024) (39 points | 68 comments)
13. Calm tech certification "rewards" less distracting tech (245 points | 67 comments)
14. Castle Game Engine: Web target – big progress, first 3 demos to try (59 points | 11 comments)
15. Evo: Version control that works the way you think (24 points | 21 comments)
16. Mercator: Extreme (142 points | 29 comments)
17. Interview with Jeff Atwood, Co-Founder of Stack Overflow (34 points | 44 comments)
18. Open-source browser port of Pitfall from the Atari 2600 (45 points | 11 comments)
19. Dissecting "Tiny Clouds" shadertoy (2017) (30 points | discuss)
20. Ask HN: Is anyone doing anything cool with tiny language models? (326 points | 148 comments)
21. The Peppermills of Jens Quistgaard (63 points | 37 comments)
22. The first release of OpenVox, the OSS implementation of Puppet (13 points | 1 comment)
23. JReleaser: quick and effortless way to release your project (65 points | 18 comments)
24. Rafael Araujo's 20 Mesmerizing Geometrical Masterpieces (2024) (99 points | 13 comments)
25. HyperDX (YC S22) is hiring engineers to build open source observability ( | hide)
26. Sigstore: Making sure your software is what it claims to be (67 points | 20 comments)
27. Prime numbers so memorable that people hunt for them (126 points | 69 comments)
28. Flame: A small language model for spreadsheet formulas (2023) (6 points | 1 comment)
29. More than 40% of postdocs leave academia, study reveals (173 points | 196 comments)
30. Show HN: I made a app that uses NFC as a physical switch to block distractions (161 points | 91 comments)
